description: Unique identifier for the inventory transaction.
Identifier grouping multiple transactions for batch processing/posting; confirm conventions with SME.
Code indicating whether stock was issued or received into inventory; confirm code set with SME.
Transaction type code categorizing the movement (such as issue, receipt, adjustment, transfer); confirm mapping with SME.
Effective date and time of the transaction used for inventory and accounting timing.
External invoice number associated with the transaction for matching and audit; likely populated on receipts or returns; confirm with SME.
Date on the associated external invoice used for terms, matching, and audit.
User or approver who released or authorized the transaction.
User who received the items or acknowledged the transaction; null when not applicable.
Free-text notes or justification for the transaction.
Indicator that the transaction was exported or sent to an external system or interface; confirm usage and values with SME.
Total tax amount applied to the transaction header.
Freight or shipping charges allocated to this transaction.
Other non-tax, non-freight charges allocated to this transaction.
User-defined header field for site-specific data; semantics configured locally.
User-defined header field for site-specific data; semantics configured locally.
User-defined header field for site-specific data; semantics configured locally.
User-defined header field for site-specific data; semantics configured locally.
User-defined header field for site-specific data; semantics configured locally.
Lifecycle status code for the transaction (such as open, posted, closed); confirm with SME.
Code of the warehouse or stocking location where the transaction occurred or is recorded.
Flag indicating whether workflow or warehouse processing is in progress; meaning unclear; confirm with SME.
Reference to the originating order or work order transaction that generated this movement; confirm exact linkage with SME.
System-generated audit or process log details for the transaction; confirm structure and content with SME.
Tax percentage rate used to calculate the tax amount.
Indicator that costs should be expensed to a cost center rather than capitalized to inventory; confirm values and behavior with SME.
Flag noting the movement pertains to tool inventory or tooling items; confirm impact on costing and controls with SME.
Identifier of a related transaction, enabling cross-reference (for example, the paired side of a transfer).
Identifier of the supplier associated with the transaction, used on receipts or returns.
Purchase order number related to the transaction, used for matching receipts, returns, or invoices.
User who created the transaction.
Timestamp when the transaction record was created.
User who last modified the transaction.
Timestamp of the most recent modification.
Date and time the transaction was posted to inventory and/or the general ledger.
Identifier linking to attached documents or images related to the transaction, such as invoices or packing slips.
